item.title: fall-winter 2024-2025
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall spiraling nebula at different speeds cars in reverse these trees bless me with their leaves partly breezy today an evening ray of sun illuminates swarming gnats – the fountain’s patter skylight orange hue relaxing caress of air, nature’s sublime kiss winter magnolia tree - solving a boulder problem in the front yard two cigarette butts wedging deep into cedar bark – cold, cold heart in the roll of a wave the washing oak branches above carry me to the clouds

item.title: spring-summer 2024
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: spring springtails circle withering stalks of mint – trees dance the Wind humid dew skin feels all pains deeply, in air weeks with many endings different shadows now old poems one slow one on the nose two women, sneezing squirrel traipsing on wire greeting mosquitoes summer towering above overtaking all observed rushing to the end never-ending flow the earth’s cold grasp, below ready for the end warring wasps finding a way back a poisoned home incarcerated house forsaken daughter wages god’s return, in Time slow day beneath strong wind restless peace soft twilight moisture in my breath chirp, chirp, hidden curious cardinal upon on leafy bough hovering to ground invert wooden corner spider webs a wee ant in mosquito humidity age unknown beneath my feet a Spanish cypress wade out stumbling on sand dip beneath the break moment of sadness, the problem-solving teacher waxing wasp’s nest vapor bombards skin : trio of house sparrows resilient, wooden soft strummed tones fossilized paws beneath my feet, a springs scent of the pine twilight sways with wind cresting a rocky giant crickets at my feet flutters the bush warbler – a piny refuge

item.title: spring-summer 2023
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: fighting for my life, from my desk to the Uintas
item.content:encoded: spring wave pummels sadness washes up, rot in my brain, smoke in the Texas air portends a life, disastrous storms for weeks and Ventus’ heavy sighs : taps on skylight glass summer wind tones cresting Uintas’ ridge, birds court bees pine scent, citronella smoke swirls, chipmunk’s chirp me! lake in the mountains triangle, edges of dead trees salamander hunting grounds corner of my eye an eye around the corner, a wary stranger

item.title: fall-winter 2022-2023
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall noble warrior Thisis, solemn and true – great autumn oak guardian on the river’s vanishing edge hear his cry, a plea for esteem betrayal, reveals the flower of anger a true being Stillness in fall’s ancient air, Symmetry wheel grinds the autumn windstorm Beneath her feet looking out these big moments – seem so small breeze on skin – peace on surface water one long summer gasp out front white lake line murmurs, flowers whistle orphaned leaves dancing a war in overhead grass dots the orange sky winter unknown purpose - they search for so long in a cloudy sky hummingbird dodges, coursing standstill raindrops, please flip switch the spring!

item.title: spring-summer 2022
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: final girl in the Vandy horror picture show moves to Austin
item.content:encoded: spring purple blooms | for the first time in years they crunch beneath my old-aged thoughts my sum of work traverses two pages :: last Tennessee spring internal forces full moon in Pisces quit deluding! summer sweet smell of white wildflowers ««≈…‡…‡…‡ blue moons eclipse at an angle then move away birds flock to cedar leaves, one last go air hums in cosmic threads at midnight

item.title: spring-summer 2021
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: end of undergrad and feeling like the end is in sight
item.content:encoded: spring dogwoods wish petals sending warm love – ambient footsteps first crop – gradually startles a Conscience dreams of farms and glory sweaty sinews; love’s rhythm two days in a row battle, good and evil no grey in community past shame some how withers I harden first world problem is privilege knowing life ends well how long? my child trains dimensions filtered … unfiltered filter summer My cats, Amie (left) and Chaussure (right). dogwood blooms – love each other, overflowing the edge of the pond residential concrete crow caws to robin unfenced front yard words light the gas doubt billows from the subcortex – gloom sizzles inside cloudy waves their turbulent serenity reflecting lifetime serotonin spurs inspiration … for sunburnt shoulders Haiku summer – Reading poet’s names A big world building your own website = pure ontology atop a slant there is the hospital storm … pending binary songbird : leaps from signpost to branch on leeward gust city’s peace : my father’s infinite chagrin vanishes phone eats first the simple dishes are rarely bland ball moss… between my fingertips springs trickle image search is mother of us all – in a desolate scape heat in the shade – cocktail opposed to coffee shunning me again pixel rain falling to a dubstep beat L, L L hacking away at wood and python also my forehead poems are my spells cast away free chilly morning dew : shapes the river valley crescent of clouds summer eve – together on the wood the taste of sambal warmth of coffee at the Korean market a heartfelt friend sister and brother : mother is kind rectress teaching her sun

item.title: winter 2020-2021
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: quiet and rainy windows are closed, but listen world solitude devotion – sun that invites you upon inspection seated on winter grass – computer juxtaposed for final studies this is a coup trump = white supremacy is domestic terrorism carbonation, sip the popping bubbles winter rainfall snow not sticking – a son honors his father claiming his mantle screen replays gaming loops before me day lost to clouds watching romances traces of myself in every lip’s furl surprise, my kidneys! who knows what occurs beneath skin tree in the wind just so happy to be here bright clouds, cold blue : dark window opened growth of epochs cold inspection for the cold veggie harvest – in warm clothes the repeat burglar saunters through those aisles again

item.title: fall-winter 2018-2019
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall to her autumn means outside ball is everything grey room fits dying leaves, not how he feels winter before happened two fraternal hounds – dry yard grass no order in time’s quanta next does not exist

item.title: spring-summer 2018
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: first-year at Vandy, early in my relationship
item.content:encoded: spring fatalidade -- pelo pecado puro e decepção verde fatality -- by the pure sin and green deception urbano crescimento -- humano cidades construídos em cima de outras urban development -- human cities built on others summer window beams – eggs rest on rice caving in My chest crumbles with anxiety Waiting to board their flight
